page.title: 012 AMALGAMATED COUNTIES
page.content: Reaching 600ft at its highest point, this area occasionally becomes inaccessible in bad winter weather. Primarily a farming area, the population however now includes a number of people commuting to nearby towns and cities, and some retired professionals. There are some good examples of church, domestic and agricultural architecture from the 15th, 18th and 19th Centuries. Many previously rather poor dwellings have been pleasantly and well converted to a good modern standard. The population has remained much the same numerically for many centuries, but unfortunately a lack of young children within recent years has made the small primary schools unviable. There is travelling involved for all services, the majority being by private car.
